page.title: 07Swainston Manor in the Past.
page.content: Swainston Manor is the{largest and {oldest building}in our area.The name of the house is said to derive from a Viking called{Sweyne}who is thought to have settled on the same site as the present house. The house was for many years the property of the Bishops of Winchester, until it was seized by King Edward 1.Later it became the property of the Barrington family, in whose ownership it remained for 300 years.The last member of the family lived here until 1941, when the house was bombed during a wartime air raid. Full repairs were begun in 1950 and they took four years to complete at a cost of Â£50,000.The Manor then became a{private school,}until in 1981 it became a{hotel}for the first time.The oldest part of the Manor is the 12th. century chapel which is at present used for dances and banquets.
